properties.areaDesc: Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu; Manua
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 11:03AM SBT by NWS Pago Pago AS
properties.description:
Gale force winds continue to impact the coastal waters of
American Samoa due to an active monsoon trough across the area.
Sustained winds 30 to 35 knots, with higher gusts, can be expected
through Tuesday morning.

Strong winds coupled with large storm surges can generate hazardous
waves which could capsize or damage vessels. Widespread showers,
heavy at times can also reduce visibility, especially near
thunderstorms.

Mariners should consider altering plans to avoid possible hazardous
conditions. Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or
secure the vessel for severe wind and seas.

Listen to NOAA Weather Radio for the latest updates. You may also
follow us on Facebook "NWSPagoPago" or our website at
www.weather.gov/ppg.

NWSheadline: A Gale Warning is in effect for American Samoa coastal waters
